title: Bug: forge install creates lib directory even when error is reported due to dirty git workspace.
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

_No response_

### What command(s) is the bug in?

_No response_

### Operating System

None

### Describe the bug

```console
$ forge install https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts
Installing openzeppelin-contracts in /Users/janitor/op/lib/openzeppelin-contracts (url: Some("https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts"), tag: None)
Error:
The target directory is a part of or on its own an already initialized git repository,
and it requires clean working and staging areas, including no untracked files.

Check the current git repository's status with `git status`.
Then, you can track files with `git add ...` and then commit them with `git commit`,
ignore them in the `.gitignore` file, or run this command again with the `--no-commit` flag.

If none of the previous steps worked, please open an issue at:
https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/issues/new/choose
21:29:40 Wed Dec 13 2023 janitor macbook /Users/janitor/op master
$ forge install https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts --no-commit
Installing openzeppelin-contracts in /Users/janitor/op/lib/openzeppelin-contracts (url: Some("https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts"), tag: None)
fatal: 'lib/openzeppelin-contracts' already exists and is not a valid git repo
Error:
git submodule exited with code 128
21:29:53 Wed Dec 13 2023 janitor macbook /Users/janitor/op master
```
